Project Engineer (Pipeline) Job at Felton Energy Services Limited




        
    

        
        Felton Energy Services Limited (FESL) is an indigenous oil & gas procurement, operation and maintenance company in Nigeria. The company was established to supply global customers with Electrical, Mechanical, Industrial and Engineering Products, on time and at the most competitive prices. FESL has unrivalled commitment to the Oil & Gas Industry and has gained support of the leading manufacturers which ensures our solutions are at the forefront oftoday’s technology.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Engineer (Pipeline)

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-tim

Role Overview
     

            
    




	We are seeking an experienced Project Engineer (Pipeline) with at least 5 years of experience in pipeline projects.
	The ideal candidate will manage engineering and project execution while also contributing to business development by bringing in new opportunities for pipeline projects.


Key Responsibilities


	Project Planning & Execution: Develop detailed project plans, schedules, and budgets for pipeline projects, ensuring timely and cost-effective delivery.
	Design & Technical Oversight: Review engineering designs, specifications, and drawings to ensure compliance with industry standards and client requirements.
	Quality & Safety Compliance: Ensure adherence to QA/QC standards, HSE regulations, and statutory requirements throughout the project lifecycle.
	Vendor & Stakeholder Coordination: Liaise with procurement, QA/QC, and construction teams to ensure timely delivery of materials and services.
	Site Supervision: Conduct site inspections, monitor progress, and resolve technical issues during project execution.
	Documentation & Reporting: Prepare technical reports, progress updates, and maintain accurate project documentation for stakeholders.
	Risk Management: Identify potential risks and implement mitigation strategies to ensure project success.
	Business Development: Identify and pursue new business opportunities related to pipeline projects; build and maintain strong relationships with clients and partners to drive revenue growth.
	Client Engagement: Act as the primary technical point of contact for clients, ensuring satisfaction and repeat business.
	Continuous Improvement: Recommend process improvements and innovative solutions to enhance project efficiency and profitability.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical, Civil, or Pipeline Engineering.
	5+ years of experience in pipeline projects within the oil & gas sector.
	Strong understanding of industry standards, codes, and regulatory requirements.
	Business development experience in pipeline projects is a plus.


What We’re Looking For:


	Strong technical knowledge of pipeline engineering and project management.
	Proven ability to manage multiple projects within deadlines and budgets.
	Excellent communication and negotiation skills for client engagement and business development.
	Ability to lead teams and collaborate across departments.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: wendy@feltonenergy.net using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Senior Sales Executive - 3PL Services",
  "description": "CourierPlus is a leading logistics and distribution services company established in 2009. We offer a wide array of express courier and logistic support solutions to our various customers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Senior Sales Executive - 3PL Services

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary


	We are seeking experienced and result-driven Senior Sales Executives (3PL) to drive business growth through the acquisition and management of key corporate and enterprise clients. The ideal candidate will have strong knowledge of 3PL solutions, excellent negotiation skills, and a proven track record in logistics sales.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify, develop, and close new 3PL business opportunities (warehousing, distribution, last-mile delivery, line haul, contract logistics).
	Manage and grow existing corporate and enterprise client accounts.
	Prepare and present commercial proposals, pricing models, and service-level agreements (SLAs).
	Work closely with Operations, Network, and Finance teams to ensure seamless service delivery.
	Conduct market research to identify new sectors and emerging opportunities.
	Meet and exceed assigned sales targets and revenue KPIs.
	Lead negotiations and contract renewals with key clients.
	Provide regular sales reports, forecasts, and pipeline updates to management.
